name: My Cross Canada Journey Multiple Choice Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: We will start in the Newfoundland region. Which of these statements is  true about Newfoundland?
options: The proper name of the province is Newfoundland and Labrador
questions.explanation:
All of these are true.

	Newfoundland is an island, while Labrador is part of the mainland. The province is nicknamed The Rock because of its mountains. The mountains in Newfoundland are attached to the Labrador region.

questions.text: Next we cross into the province of Nova Scotia. It is completely in what time zone?
questions.explanation:
Atlantic.

	The Atlantic time zone includes Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island, and Labrador. The other five time zones are Newfoundland, Eastern, Central, Mountain and Pacific.

questions.text: Now we cross the famous bridge into Prince Edward Island. What's the name of that big bridge?
questions.explanation:
Confederation Bridge.

	The Confederation Bridge extends 12.9 kilometers (eight miles) and takes about ten minutes to cross. It cost 1.3 billion Canadian dollars  to build and was constructed between 1995-1997.

questions.text: On to New Brunswick.  Which of these cities won't I see in New Brunswick?
questions.explanation:
Sydney.

	Sydney is a major city in Nova Scotia. Saint John is the largest city in New Brunswick. Fredericton is the capital city of New Brunswick. Moncton is the largest metropolitan area.

questions.text: Now we move into Quebec. What is the official language of Quebec?
questions.explanation:
French.

	Quebec is the only province with English not an official language. It is also the second largest Canadian province in terms of population and the largest in size.

questions.text: On to Ontario, where the citizens are crazy for sports. In which of these leagues does Ontario NOT have a franchise?
questions.explanation:
National Football League.

	The Toronto Marlies and Hamilton Bulldogs are Ontario's entries in the AHL. The Toronto Nationals are in the MLL. The Toronto Raptors occupy Canada's only entry in the NBA. Although the Buffalo Bills have started to play a pre-season and regular season in Toronto, there is no team in Ontario.

questions.text: We roll into Manitoba and go into the capital city, which is home to the Millennium Library.  Name it.
questions.explanation:
Winnipeg.

	Winnipeg is the capital city of Manitoba and is located in the south-central part of the province. It's also Manitoba's largest and traditionally most populous city.

questions.text: We enter Saskatchewan and the welcome sign includes "Province since ___."  When did Saskatchewan become a province?
questions.explanation:
1905.

	Saskatchewan officially became a province on September 1, 1905.  It was Canada's sixth province. It is home to cities such as Saskatoon and Regina.

questions.text: Almost at the end of our journey! We head into Alberta and realize that we are entering a mountainous area. What are these mountains called?
questions.explanation:
Rocky Mountains.

	The Rocky Mountains run from Alaska through Central America. In Canada, the mountains are found in Western Alberta and Eastern British Columbia.

questions.text: This is the end. We made it to British Columbia! Which of these famous Canadians is not a native of BC?
questions.explanation:
Avril Lavigne.

	Although all four are Canadian, only Avril is not originally from British Columbia.  She is a native of Belleville, Ontario. Kim Campbell is from Port Alberni, while both Joe Sakic and Michael Buble are from Burnaby BC.
